{"id":1273757103,"question_id":42,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 week, 5 days","timestamp":1717208981,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"1 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1273757103/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Trapping Rain Water","memory":"45.7 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int trap(int[] h) {\n\n        int len = h.length;\n\n        int[] leftMax = new int[len];\n        for(int i=0; i<len; i++){\n            leftMax[i] = i==0 ? h[0] : Math.max(h[i], leftMax[i-1]);\n        }\n\n        int[] rightMax = new int[len];\n        for(int i=len-1; i>=0; i--){\n            rightMax[i] = i==len-1 ? h[len-1] : Math.max(h[i], rightMax[i+1]);\n        }\n\n\n        int res = 0;\n        for(int i=1; i<len-1; i++){\n            res += Math.min(leftMax[i], rightMax[i])-h[i];\n        }\n\n        return res;\n        \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"trapping-rain-water","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
